comment: Well, to keep it a simple read... He's obviously someone that was passionate about math(an ex "math luver")dried out, out of his prime, an "old soul" that for some reason likes making the class more difficult, bad, luckily I passed with an A, he seemed upset he couldn't fail me or keep me down like the rest. Don't take his "im different" class. Ugh
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: Math3260 (linear algebra) good teacher, not the greatest for a summer class because wants to go into super detail on things which aren't super necessary. Nice person and wants to see you do well. But be ready to do lots of work and study a pretty good amount, if you know thats not you don't take his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Mr. Berman is a okay prof. You've REALLY gotta love math to get an A. He expects a super deep understanding of all prior math class material and does not address prior concepts in the lectures. Explains the concepts, then asks for questions after problems, so lectures are not very interactive unless you initiate. Put in the work and you can do it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: The class was not as bad as it was made out to be. He was very clear, do the homework (even though it was optional) and you will do just fine in the class. It is a lot of homework, but quizzes and tests are duplicates of it. He also gives a pretty decent curve on tests not quizzes though. Great guy! very dependent outside class. JUST DO HOMEWORK
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Avoid at all costs. Homework is overwhelming and “optional”—quizzes/tests copy it verbatim. This was my lowest grade and highest effort. Tests include unseen questions, lectures have irrelevant tangents, and the professor yells if you get it wrong, or right. I counted ~25 students at first, and 13 at last lecture. Save yourself—take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Berman was a very unique and humbling teacher. He assigns a lot of hw and about 10 quizzes per semester, but the hw is not graded. Regardless you have to do the hw to understand what you are covering. In class he can explain theorems and proofs in good detail and outside of class you can set up meetings to go over problems with him.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Berman was very straight forward. If you can do the homework you will do well in his class. you are able to set up meeting times outside of class and he even had open office hours to take advantage of
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Worked example problems as a way to teach the fundamentals. Gave a lot of homework yes, but do you did it the tests were nothing unexpected. Hard class but if you listen to Professor Berman it was an easy A if you put in the work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Berman's class is no walk in the park. Tons of homework and killer exams, but if you put in the work, you'll gain a deep understanding. Unstuck study was a lifesaver for prepping.

His classes are for people who want to learn math. Yes, he assigns a lot of homework, but the only way to learn something is to practice it. He will go out of his way to help students understand the material. The truth is, most students are just looking for an easy A. If you want to learn math, take him. If not, find someone else.

I took him last year, and I'm still burned out from the work load. Assigns a minimum of 30 problems every class session, then only grades 3 (the hardest ones usually) at "random". He failed over half my class, and the only reason I barely passed was that I never missed a lecture. If I missed a single class, I would've failed... Avoid him please.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If not for the character limit, I could write a whole essay of reasons why not to take his class but to keep it simple he speeds through his lectures then assigns a MINIMUM of 20 HW questions (one time he gave us 50), gives random pop quizzes each week which are based on the HW so even though the HW isn't graded u technically gotta do it anyways.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: Easily one of the worst professors ive ever had. He would only teach certain things in class then give us 20 problems of Ungraded HW every class. The only way to learn what was going on in the class was to do the HW. Yet the test would be something entirely different and more complex than the HW. Avoid this teacher at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment:
I actually took him for MATH1113
I enjoy his style of teaching a lot. Yes, he's a tough grader, but I like his lectures- his teaching emphasizes connecting the dots in math. You for definitely have to pay attention, but if you do then the homework will be much easier. Courseload is a lot, but a reasonable amount for assignment/s due in 5-7 days.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Do not take his class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I'm gonna be honest I failed bc I skipped class and missed an exam. He assigns a ton of hw that he won't grade but he'll be super mad if no one does it. Pop quizzes. Tests are only 10-12 questions. Not very nice likes to scold. Makes the class way harder than it needed to be. If you do not prioritize this class you will be punished.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Jeff's a nice guy, but his class is bad. Way too much homework, super difficult tests, and class is mostly theory we don't need to know. He's only worth taking if you know calc already and want to dive deeper. For most students, this isn't the case, and most of the stuff you learn won't be helpful to you. He's notorious for a reason, he's a risk.

One of the best professors. Don't listen to the reviews, albeit, there is some truth like lots of homework and good pre-req knowledge. I like that, keeps me on my toes. His teaching style encourages deep understanding, useful in many fields. We had a small convo after the final exam, very personable. I hope UGA or Georgia Tech has more like him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Don't waste your money taking his courses. He assigns 6+ hours of homework EVERY class, and almost never grades it. When he does, he grades three questions at "random", which are almost always the impossible theory questions. Spent 8 hours on one homework, and he gave me a 37 because of that. PLEASE, do not waste your time on him!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: My review was taken down even though I followed the "Guidelines", so I'm assuming jeff probably reported it also. it seems like someone does not like the truth. He is not a good professor and would not recommend him to anyone. His writing is extremely difficult to read which makes it hard to keep up. the syllabus also said 6 tests but only gave 4.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: My review is missing, so I'm assuming Jeff found and reported it. Let me make this clear, Jeff is not a good professor. I've had to skip other classes to finish his homework, and he won't even grade it. His tests are the most difficult I've ever had, and he barely gives partial credit. Lectures are only worth going to for the quizzes. Avoid him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment:
If at any point you struggle or have a question its a lost cause
He wont approach things from a diff perspective to help your understanding and is condescending/will belittle you, saying things such as "Have you tried thinking about it"
Lecture is all theory/derivations
Get ready to teach yourself (if you can) through the mountains of hw he assigns
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: First things first, he expects you to know the criteria from calc 1.The test are made from the hardest questions of all the homework's (up to 50 questions per subject). To top it off the homework isn't even graded, so your just doing it for practice. But if you make it through he is willing to be a great resource for further his students careers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Mr. Berman is a fantastic mathematician. The man is very knowledgeable about any questions you have regarding math or any other subjects. That being said, I did find myself having to use additional resources outside of his lectures in order to keep up. Is this a fault of his, or is this a fault of calculus II as a class? My money is on the latter.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's clearly very passionate about math, but he's not great at teaching the material. He can be condescending when students ask questions in class review. He will explain problems using methods not covered in the course. If you can't avoid taking him make sure to do all the HW problems he assigns. They will show up again in tests/quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: I do not think the reviews do him justice. Sure this class is hard but he is more than willing to go through any and all problems step by step until you understand. Homework is long but if you can get to a point where you can do it by yourself then you have a very good chance on doing well on the tests/weekly quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! The tests are extremely difficult. He expects everyone to spend hours on hw problems from the textbook everyday and expects everyone have to have a deep understanding of trig and algebra. You are only graded by 5 tests and weekly pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Berman is very harsh, he does a couple of practice problems in class and expects you to go home and do 40 difficult homework questions on your own without any resources and has a very big ego. His class average was 40% and said that he was not the issue when 3 classes averaged 40%.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Berman is a very nice and smart guy. That being said, his class is not easy. He teaches straight from the textbook which is great but, his tests are insanely hard and he does not give out partial credit very easily. Class average for the first unit test was a 40 (and that was a review from Calc 1). I would definitely take an easier prof.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Berman was an all out amazing professor. He knew how to properly explain topics in an easy to learn way and could help with any questions asked in class no matter how long it took. He has a pop quiz every week about the topics discussed the prior week, but the quizzes are straight from the homework. Tests are similar too, but longer.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Berman was one of the most difficult professors I've taken at KSU with insane amounts of homework that feels very unrewarding with the grading style however, he does take the time to go over problems that students have and was very understanding when going over various concepts. You'll learn calculus but it will take a lot of time and work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Mr. Berman was a good professor, and he definitely was very caring for Diff EQ, however, his class was somewhat difficult. His tests did not have very high class averages, but he would compensate by curving or giving extra credit. He taught the material well, and his homework helped a lot when studying for tests. He is very accessible as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: This was the most difficult class I took at KSU. The amount of homework assigned is abhorent in quantity. You must attend every lecture, do every HW, and do all extra credit. You will fail the tests. They are horrendously difficult. Only take this with Jeff if you are certain you'll immerse yourself in Calculus and have bedrock-solid fundamentals.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Mr. Berman was probably the best math teacher I have ever had. He is very passionate about math and will help you learn on a deeper level. He is pretty heavy on homework but if you do all of it and understand all of it you will do very well on the tests. Make sure you are solid on your algebra and trig if you take this class. It will be on the test
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Please take another professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Avoid him PLEASE, his lectures are fast paced and his handwriting sucks. he gets upset when you ask questions. Homework ranges from 15-30 questions and he only picks 3 randomly to grade. The exams are worse, he gives questions that require you to prove concepts that we do not know yet and are impossible to solve within the allotted time period.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: very torn on how to rate jeff. nice guy but homework amt is pretty bad, graded strangely - he only picks 3 or so problems to grade out of like 30, so you could miss 2 and get a 66. tests are much simpler content-wise more forgiving. INCREDIBLE at explaining stuff that never "clicked" for me before... would rate a 5 if the homework wasn't sort of BS
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Respected

comment: Stay away from older professors such as Berman. He lacks understanding and empathy. He prides himself on having a drop/fail/withdrawal rate of 60% and greater. He doesn't believe that students can be taught but rather you know it or you don't. His solution to any issue or concern you may have is to "drop the class".
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He places EXTREME emphasis on the conceptual/understanding side of the math he teaches, especially on tests. One nice thing is that every test is curved, adding at least 10 points to your grade %. If you're just used to wrote memorization without understanding, this class will be HARD.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This guy is actually the worst. Avoid him at all costs. He expects you to have an encyclopedic knowledge of calc 1 & calc 2. He gives insane amounts of homework and then grades your homework off of 3 randomly selected problems. (It takes easily 2+ hours) His test are incredibly difficult and will often hinge on a completely obscure trig identities.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Anyone who takes this class and rates it a 5/5 is lying to themselves. imagine paying a thousand dollars to take this garbage heap of a class. IF you want to pass this class reach out to an external resource and try your damndest to not mess up a single problem. it better be written correctly or most of your points disappear. Do NOT sign up for him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Jeff is a good person, but that does not make him a good teacher. I guarantee that he will give you information overload and you won't be able to process all of it. For math, he tends to derive an equation that could be pages long. He says he does it for you to understand the concept, however, he fails to explain the concept very well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: You get out what you put into his class. If you commit yourself to working all the homework, studying the textbook, and using office hours to ask questions, you will grow IMMENSELY as a student and as a mathematician. If you don't put in the hours to solidify your understanding of the concepts, it will show, and you'll feel it during the tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: He honestly was good at giving external sources to be better but he could not teach. I felt like every question I asked I got a response that made me feel dumb for not knowing this because he would always "we already know how to do this." I knew I was screwed when half of his class was cut in half after the last drop or add period. Do not do this.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: fast lectures/expects you to understand material the first time; HW heavy (test is word for word the HW); e.g. assigned over 90 problems for a single section, yet test is only 7 questions; can't use math techniques not discussed in class (even if it will be discussed later); tough grader; e.g. took off half credit, because I did not put "y ="
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Stop. DO NOT take this professor. He is by far the hardest professor I've ever had and unnecessarily so. The expectation far exceeds the scope of the class. He WILL belittle and laugh at you if you ask a question. He talks at lightning speed and writes chicken scratch. He also refuses to post ANY notes on D2L for reference.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: I took him in the fall and he is very adamant about teaching his students the concepts of the material. Jeff highly encourages students to do the homework as the pop quizzes and some of the test questions come from the book. He gets a bad rep due to his difficulty, but he's great at answering questions and truly wants whats best for his students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly an incredible teacher. The guy knows exactly what he's talking about and he genuinely wants to learn. That being said he expects a good bit out of you. You will have to put forth some effort. That being said he does want you to succeed. There is a lot of homework, do it all, and come to class with questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mr. Berman is an incredible professor. He emphasizes the development of understanding concepts well so that students wouldn't just need to memorize formulas. He gives a good amount of homework. His exams and quizzes are all based on homework problems, so doing the homework and asking questions in class makes it easy to do well in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Jeff's class can be hard at times and his lectures, which have theory in them, can seem confusing at times, but by the time the test comes, you'll usually have a good understanding of material and pass. Jeff is very caring as a person and is extremely available outside of class. He wants to make sure you truly understand the concepts and do well.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Do not take this class. He teaches the material by just writing out examples (his writing is difficult to read) and then moving on. If you stop him to ask him to review something he will make you feel as though you are dumb for having to ask. If you can take any other professor, because he was the worst math prof i have ever had.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: If you like formal math and care a lot about understanding difficult concepts, you'll love Jeff and Jeff will love you. Know that the content of this class is difficult and requires time, patience, and persistence. Be prepared to work hard and this class will work for you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a difficult professor, no doubt about it. He gives many examples and exams can be a challenge. Also, beware of the amount of homework. BUT his intentions are good and his class will benefit the hard working student all day everyday. Great professor who cares about you and how much you learn from him. He is solely in it to help students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Jeff is really well versed in his knowledge of mathematics, he really knows what he's doing. However, he teaches material that goes beyond what is required for the class, and lacks patience when student struggle with very difficult concepts. His tests are also very.. VERY hard. Be ready so sacrifice most of your time to pass his class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Jeff was a great professor that really knows his stuff. He spends the first part of class going through any questions people had on HW, then gets into the lecture. Exams were 3 questions and asynchronous, but are very difficult. But he is always available to ask questions and really doesn't want you to fail. He goes beyond the surface-level stuff.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Calc. 3 is very hard with a lot theoretical problems. Professor Berman is very passionate in what he teaches which can come off as intimidating. The best advice I can give you reading this is do not cheat. Test were uploaded to Chegg and the professor found out. Half the class dropped it after he dropped the hammer on them. Learn and do not cheat.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: If you enjoy your weekends in the slightest, stay away from him at all costs I am serious . If not, you'll be enjoying 4 day long exams from Friday-monday. The exams are also very difficult.

Expect to spend +8 hours per week just doing homework outside of class. NEWSFLASH, almost nobody needs this. Expect him to get upset if you aren't learning as quickly as he is teaching. maybe this is me, but to have to do +60 problems and have your grade rely on only 2 at random left me with a constant feeling of defeat. Like my work didn't matter.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He grades his test harshly, even though you follow the notes. Following your notes and your book WILL NEVER do anything for you. Plus, he gets mad when students don't understand what to do.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: requires tons of homework but only grades a single question randomly and you have to get it right exactly. I got a problem right but because I didn't place a limit sign he took off 30 points...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: He understands the material very well, however he has a tendency to overdue it on homework and not take it up at whatever time he chooses. On top of this he is very critical on what test answers he approves of, if the answer is right but not in his terms he will still fail it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Jeff Berman seems like a decent guy, but I did not enjoy his class in the slightest. He makes the material more difficult than it needs to be. He spends a lot of lecture going into theory. You'll be lost the majority of the time. Be prepared to spend 4 hrs/week min doing homework outside of this class. Some weeks you can double/triple that number!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He explains everything and gives alot of examples. If you do your homework, you will literally be fine. Many of the ones that fail the course do not ask any questions. He reviews homework before each class and the day before test are review days. He responds quick to emails and office hours are always open. Just ask questions and you will PASS
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's a super smart teacher. He has an engineering background so engineers taking him will definitely benefit from his class. There's about 10-20 homework questions due on the day of class. The 3 question tests were open note and we had about 3 days to work on it. I wish I could say the tests were easy but honestly Chegg is gonna be your life saver.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jeff is a real pro at math, but his lectures tend to get bogged down in theory so unless you ask questions, which he makes time for, it's going to be really tough. Despite the very challenging homework and tests, there was a lot of help available and he really made himself accessible outside of class. Overall, be prepared to work for your grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took Berman since his ratings seemed good, but his class seems vastly different in the covid online format. He cares about math, but his lectures are unhelpful since he just goes into useless theory and gets annoyed at questions. Homework load is around 7-8 hours a week and his tests are extremely difficult. Avoid if you're an engineer.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I would not take this class unless you are a Mathematic Major. He will go into deep theory's that any engineer should not care about at all. He will laugh in your face if you ask a question and wonders why nobody wants to ask questions. The test are nothing like any other calc III class. He also gives a stupid amount of homework for each class26Q.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible teacher for calc 3. He goes over stuff that is not relevant to the material we are learning, he is super unhelpful when you ask for help and his test are just his made up questions that involve techniques far beyond what any other calc 3 class uses. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The worst math teacher I have had. FLIES through the content (1 sect a day), and if you have a question you'll be belittled and nearly berated for not knowing. His tests are nothing like the homework, and you'll spend 5 hours MIN. on homework PER SECTION. You'll dedicate more time to this class than all others combined. I have to self teach to pas
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Lots of homework that is not required, but if you do not do it you will not pass. He is kind but the lectures are near impossible to understand. He teaches it like a graduate class. Everyone in the class is lost after the first 20 to 30 minutes. I taught myself the whole class and was able to figure out how the class works after the first test.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: CALC3: Professor Berman is a pretty smart guy. He knows exactly what he is talking about 100% of the time; however, just because he knows doesn't mean you'll understand. If you are not already good at math, you will not get an A. If you are good at math, getting an A will still be extremely difficult. Despite this, I learned a ton from this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Took Berman last semester (Spring 2019) for Calc 3, which in general is a hard subject; he was a solid choice. The homework problems prepared for the tests, and the in-class examples were helpful in understanding the concepts. He also regularly held review sessions. Attend the lecture, do the homework, read the book, and you'll be alright.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Berman cares about his students and you can tell he loves subject during the lectures. Yes the class is a bit difficult, but you cannot expect to ace the class without doing work on your own. Most of the negative reviews are by students who expect to ace his class without working. If you are willing to do the work expected, the class is not hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: One of the hardest professors I've ever taken. I respect the guy because ODE is a hard class but he does not do anything to make it easier. No cheat sheet/formula sheet. 4 tests and a final + Pop quizzes for extra credit. If you go to SI and do homework you have a better chance but if you are aware of your work ethic and abilities in math, Beware.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: On my own I can cover three sections in an hour and 40 minutes, in his lecture I can't comprehend anything at all because his teaching style is so poor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Youre better off using Khan. He teaches in an unclear and ineffective manner both in verbal and written. His methods are overly long and complicated thats impossible to use within a time-limit. He gives no formula sheets on the test and expects you to remember too many details under pressure. 0/10 Unrealistic expectations. Avoid at all cost.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Jeff has been criticized by many on here that simply see him as a hard teacher. The class it self is know to be one of the hardest maths one can take. Jeff is the fastest grader in the world. He gives partial credit on tests, takes time off to do extra help sessions, and asks test questions from the homework. He gives pop quiz as bonus points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He has no ability to actually teach. He's very skilled at ODE, but can't use that to help others learn it. The entire class will be constantly lost, unsure of what we're even covering, while he writes with his back to the class. Does not grade homework, few difficult tests, and comprehensive final. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Jeff is by far the hardest prof. I've taken. Nonetheless, the best. Whiteboard lecture and textbook homework- lots of it. HW not for cred, but req'd.  Take home XtraCred problems, exams make your grade, Final replaces lowest. If your not lazy and willing to put in the work, you will grow leaps and bounds! Wish Id had prof like Jeff from the start!

No grades are ever posted online.  He gives four tests and a final and homework for extra points.  We got back three tests.  I never knew what my homework points were or what I made on the last test and now I do not even know what I made on the final.  He tests are nothing like the homework.  Very few students stuck with the class until the end.

He is the worst teacher I have ever had. At the beginning of the semester there was about 30 of us in the class by the withdrawal period there was only about 8 of us left.  When explaining information, he writes notes on the board with his back turned to the class. He makes you do a lot of homework problems that are nothing like the tests.

Tests are extremely hard, but he gives extra credit here and there. He's an understanding guy- just put your work in and don't slack off. If you don't do any homework, don't expect to pass at all. Overall, he's a down to earth guy that knows his stuff. He treats every question seriously. If you want to actually learn your stuff, take him.
4 tough exams and 1 comprehensive final. Taking home problems cannot be solved. Many people dropped out this 2K math class
He taught us graduate level course material in an undergraduate course. 75% of his students withdrew from the class.

This teacher was the worst teacher I have ever had at KSU. He writes like he is writing on notebook paper on the board. If you ask him to explain a problem he will do it without any explanation and at the end he will ask if you get? HIS TEST ARE IMPOSSIBLE. He gives out the test and don't even know where to begin. DO NOT TAKE HIM

He really is the best, most down to earth professor I have ever had. He understands stress, but pushes you to achieve more. If your thinking about taking it easy, he is your last choice - you WILL fail. However, if you have passion and drive, you will find him to be so helpful and he is very good about getting back to emails (even texts) timely!

His tests are ridiculously hard. He dwells  on proofs . He expects you to do an average of 30 HW questions each section, youre doomed if you dont do the HW. He gives outrageously hard extra credit questions. You lose a good chunk of points for mixing signs or placing the equal sign wrong. Worst math experience  and I never missed a single class

and go to his (optional) study sessions!!!!! cannot emphasize that enough. If you want an easy professor, go find somebody else. If you like to learn and appreciate professors who like teaching then you must have Professor Berman as your Calculus professor!!!!

You might be intimidated by his intelligence but please do yourself a favor and do NOT drop out of his class. It is so hard to find a professor who genuinely cares about his students and has a big passion for teaching like Professor Berman! Ask questions (he will answer your questions until you understand thoroughly)
He was very hard but if you paid attention and asked questions, you understood what was expected. He knows his stuff.

Unless you are a math major, don't take this class. He spends a lot of time going over theorems instead of what will be on the homework and then complains when no one does the homework. Maybe if he would show us how to do the math problems before review, it would help. Really disappointed with this teacher. Wish I had taken someone else.

Extremely good and intelligent professor; very passionate about teaching, teaches bc he enjoys it! If you need help he will go out of his way yo help you. This being said he expects you to know the material. His tests are the hardest I've ever taken, but are very rewarding! NO CALCULATORS ALLOWED, you NEED solid algebraic fundamentals. No easy A

This professor is seriously the hardest prof I've ever had. He is so smart that he makes no sense when trying to explain things. Although he is very helpful...it doesn't help because it is very difficult to connect with him. His tests are EXTREMELY HARD and your foundations must be very strong. I do not recommend him at all

Nice prof. but VERY HARD.     Tests are very difficult.  Gives four tests that make up your grade.  Will give a few quizzes as bonus pts but these are usually in class and are hard too. DO THE HW! Ask questions.  Does help sessions.  He clearly enjoys teaching math, take if you are good at math, if not, then prepare to work! Take with few classes.

This Professor is the bomb! He's thorough, clear, and helpful. He holds study sessions every Saturday, and he sometimes gives take home quizzes. However, since he is such a great teacher, his tests are tough because he expects you to be able to do it. This class takes time and effort, but with Mr. Berman, you'll ACTUALLY Learn your stuff!

Let's be realistic, the "hard" ratings are because of the material. I've taken numerous teachers for calculus and had to drop because of the format they were teaching in. Berman is your last hope if you don't understand calc. He presents it in the way of numerical behavior, and his tests are more than fair. Know your fundamentals.. do the HW. = A

For calculus II, this teacher has very high standards for his students.  If you study hard, you can get an A.  But it requires a big time investment.  Make sure your fundamentals are solid before taking this course.

Goes to great lengths to ensure you understand all material -- if you can't learn it with Prof. Berman, you're not going to learn it at all. He'll review algebra if that's what it takes. Provides endless opportunities for grade improvement and teaches very well. Be advised: tests are very difficult, and not just because he only teaches at 8PM.
If you take him be prepared to work. Wants you to understand Cal. grades fair (mine were really bad).  you will leave the class ready for cal2.  Good class, super difficult material for me.

Extremely unorganized, including notes. It is a hard subject, but he failed to break it down. He would lecture while writing leaving you no time to comprehend and he moved around on the board erratically and erased too quickly. Used random symbols, gave hard tests and his handwriting was illegible. I don't think he's teaching calc II next semester.

He was one of the worst professors I have ever taken. He came to class unprepared almost every night; and his tests were beyond difficult. He did not explain the topics clearly and you had to go home teach yourself everything. People would then ask ridiculous questions during class, which would set us behind even further. I do NOT recommend him.
Great Teacher! Took him for Calc 1 in the fall can't wait for Calc 2 with him.  Very difficult class but he is more than willing to help with any difficulites.

AMAZING professor. Had him for Calc I, and it was a great experience. He went over every detail of the material that was presented in class, and explained it however many times was needed. Clean instructions throughout the semester and extra credit opportunities. Work hard and you will receive an A.

Awesome teacher. Extremely knowledgeable about the subject and very helpful. Has study sessions outside of class to help out. Do the homework and ask questions and you'll do good in the class. Highly recommend him.

AWESOME teacher! Very knowledgeable about the subject. Explains things in terms everyone can understand. Uses examples from the book. Test questions from quizzes, notes, hw. Nothing you didn't see in class. The most helpful teacher I've ever had. Goes above and beyond to make sure you understand the material. Recommend strong background in algebra

By far the best math teacher I've ever had. You WILL understand calculus by the end of the semester if you take his class and do the homework. He responds to email right away and treats every student question as important, no matter how small or silly it may seem.

He doesn't let you use a calculator, so if you're used to relying on one do not take him! He doesn't do a very good job at dumbing things down. He works for Lockheed and is extremely smart, it's just the process translating his knowledge to his students that's difficult. He tends to cater to ridiculous questions, therefore putting the class behind

Best math teacher I have ever had.  Did his best to make sure you understood everything.  Doesn't spoon feed you formulas, but makes you think.  It's a bit of a challenge but is well worth it.  He is very generous in his grading.  A lot of quizzes, but it helps you prepare for the tests.  Homework is not mandatory but is highly recommended.
